protein.specific_function: Mediates thiol-dependent retention in the early secretory pathway, forming mixed disulfides with substrate proteins through its conserved CRFS motif. Inhibits the calcium channel activity of ITPR1. May have a role in the control of oxidative protein folding in the endoplasmic reticulum. Required to retain ERO1L and ERO1LB in the endoplasmic reticulum

reference.reference_text: Anelli T, Alessio M, Mezghrani A, Simmen T, Talamo F, Bachi A, Sitia R: ERp44, a novel endoplasmic reticulum folding assistant of the thioredoxin family. EMBO J. 2002 Feb 15;21(4):835-44.
